_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:34:53 using v2.1
title: How have the perceptions of people feeling involved in their inpatient care changed?
analysis_commentary: The overall percentage of respondents to the Adult Inpatient Survey who felt they were involved either 'definitely' or 'to some extent' in their care and treatment remained stable at 90% in 2012 and 2013. There was no change in the percentage of patients who felt they were not involved as much as they wanted to be in their care and treatment; this was 10% in 2012 and 2013.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
